citation.article-title: Ochrobactrum pecoris sp. nov., isolated from farm animals
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Ochrobactrum pecoris sp. nov.
Ochrobactrum pecoris (pe′co.ris. L. gen. n. pecoris of livestock).
Cells are non-motile, non-spore-forming rods (approx. 2 µm long), Gram-negative and oxidase-positive and showing an oxidative metabolism.
Grows on R2A agar, TSA, nutrient agar and MacConkey agar at 25–30 °C.
Colonies are beige, translucent and shiny on R2A agar, with entire edges and a diameter of approximately 2 mm within 24 h.
Positive for hydrolysis of l-alanine p-nitroanilide (pNA) and p-nitrophenyl (pNP) phenylphosphonate and for weak hydrolysis of bis-pNP phosphate and l-proline pNA.
Negative for hydrolysis of aesculin, pNP β-d-galactopyranoside, pNP β-d-glucuronide, pNP α-d-glucopyranoside, pNP β-d-glucopyranoside, pNP phosphorylcholine and 2-deoxythymidine-5′-pNP phosphate.

Positive for utilization of N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose, inositol (weak), d-mannose, maltose, d-ribose, sucrose, trehalose, d-xylose, d-adonitol, d-sorbitol, acetate, citrate (weak), 4-aminobutyrate, propionate, fumarate, glutarate, dl-lactate, l-malate, oxoglutarate, pyruvate, l-alanine, β-alanine, l-aspartate, l-histidine, l-leucine, l-proline, l-serine and ornithine.

Negative for utilization of p-arbutin, rhamnose, salicin, putrescine, cis-aconitate, l-phenylalanine, l-tryptophan, 3-hydroxybenzoate, adipate, itaconate, mesaconate, suberate, phenylacetate, melibiose and azelate.
The quinone system is ubiquinone Q-10 with minor amounts of Q-11 and Q-9.
The polyamine pattern consists of major amounts of spermidine, putrescine and sym-homospermidine and minor amounts of 1,3-diaminopropane and spermine.
The predominant polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylmonomethylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylcholine and diphosphatidylglycerol.
Moderate amounts of two unidentified aminolipids, AL1 and the Ochrobactrum-specific AL2, and small amounts of several unknown lipids are also present.
The fatty acid profile is composed largely of C18 : 1ω7c and C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c.
The type strain, 08RB2639T ( = DSM 23868T = CCUG 60088T = CCM 7822T), was isolated from a sheep in Bosnia.
A second strain, 08RB2781-1 ( = DSM 23868 = CCM 7823), was isolated from a domestic boar in Germany.
